title: Traditions of Edinburgh.
author: Chambers, Robert
snippet: The original name of the place was Woodhead. AVhen the able lawyer came to the bench, and, as usual, thought of a new appellative of a territorial kind — 'Woodhead — Lord Woodhead,' thought he; 'that will never do for a judge!' So the name of the place was changed to Fountainhall, and he became Lord Fountainhall accoi'dingly.
